news_header: H5N1 bird flu variant D1.1 detected in dairy cattle in Nevada amidst ongoing outbreaks.
news_original_title: A second version of bird flu is infecting cows. What does that mean?
news_text: A new variant of H5N1 bird flu, D1.1, has been found in dairy cattle in Nevada, marking the first detection of this strain in cows. This discovery raises concerns about potential spillover events from birds to cattle and the implications for human health, as previous infections have mostly affected farm workers with mild symptoms. Experts emphasize the need for improved biosecurity and surveillance on dairy farms to manage the risk of H5N1 spread.
